explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 forbids modifying function parameters: scalar parameters shall not be changed and pointer parameters may not have the pointer value modified (only the object pointed to may be modified). In the provided code the parameter length (size_t) is altered (length -= bytes_left; length -= SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE;), and the pointer parameter data is also modified (data += bytes_left; data += SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE;). Both are breaches of Rule 17.8. The usual remedy is to copy parameters to local variables (e.g. size_t rem = length; const uint8_t *ptr = data;) and operate on those locals while leaving the original parameters unmodified.
